act: Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office Act 1996
section_title: Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office.
section_text: 1 1 This Act shall apply in relation to any office established in the United Kingdom by the government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region for the purposes of furthering the economic and trade interests of the Region. 2 Where an office is located outside London, this Act shall apply in relation to it only if the Secretary of State so determines. 3 The Schedule to this Act (which makes provision about privileges and immunities) shall have effect. 4 If in any proceedings a question arises whether or not a privilege or immunity applies by virtue of the Schedule to this Act, a certificate issued by the Secretary of State stating any fact relating to that question shall be conclusive evidence of that fact.

act: Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office Act 1996
section_text: 2 1 This Act may be cited as the Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office Act 1996. 2 This Act extends to Northern Ireland. 3 Her Majesty may by Order in Council direct that any of the provisions of this Act shall extend, with such modifications as appear to Her Majesty to be appropriate, to any of the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man.
